1.title: Summer Twins

episode of.title: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

1.plot: LA Music Blog's own Mary Bonney attends the kick-off Eat/See/Hear event in Santa Monica where she gets to know sisters Chelsea and Justine Brown of LA-based 50's/60's inspired garage pop/rock band Summer Twins.

2.title: Mothlight

episode of.title: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

2.plot: The LA Music Blog heads to the Eat/See/Hear event in Santa Monica to chat with the LA-based dream pop outfit Mothlight about their beginnings and plays a quote-guessing game with regards to the movie The Princess Bride.

3.title: Faulkner

episode of.title: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

3.plot: Mary Bonney of LA Music Blog gets amped for a night of David Bowie with a listening party of his greatest hits as well as a screening of Labyrinth at the Eat/See/Hear event at Pasadena City Hall. She also interviews the bi-coastal rock group Faulkner, who have something Bowie-esque of their own to perform!

4.title: Opus Orange

episode of.title: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

4.plot: Mary Bonney sets up shop at the Autry Museum in Griffith Park to interview the multi-genre band Opus Orange, who discuss how they met and drink up White Russians in honor of the outdoor screening of the cult classic The Big Lebowski at Eat See Hear!

5.title: Jaime Wyatt and the Bang Bangs

episode of.title: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

5.plot: LA Music Blog's Mary Bonney moseys on over to the North Hollywood Rec Center to "Save Ferris!" with the other moviegoers there ready to watch Ferris Bueller's Day Off for it's 30th Anniversary celebration! Before the movie, Mary interviews the Southern souls known as Jaime Wyatt and The Bang Bangs, who discuss the differences between Texas and LA, as well as what they did when they were in high school, just like Ferris!

6.title: Night Lights

episode of.title: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

6.plot: LA Music Blog heads to the North Hollywood Recreation Center once again to get in on the prehistoric action of Jurassic Park and food trucks at Eat/See/Hear! Before the showing of the movie that was 65 million years in the making, Mary interviews the band Night Lights, whose members hail from all around the world and have come together in LA to perform songs off of a new EP.

7.title: Sleeping Wolf

episode of.title: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

7.plot: LA Music Blogger and podcast co-host Marcus Slater fills in this week and trades in the heat for a lovely and cool evening at Santa Monica High School for Eat/See/Hear! Before a big-screen, outdoor showing of last year's Amy Schumer/Judd Apatow comedy riot "Trainwreck," Marcus interviews the local alt-pop duo Sleeping Wolf, who discuss the meaning behind their name, what they sound like, and if they've ever experienced any "trainwrecks" of their own.

8.title: Maszer

episode of.title: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

8.plot: LA Music Blogger Marcus Slater is on the scene at The Autry in Griffith Park for another fantastic evening of Eat/See/Hear, where he interviews and chills out to the sounds of West Coast psych/indie/pop outfit Maszer before a screening of the cult classic 90's movie set in the 70's, Dazed and Confused!

9.title: Cafuné

episode of.title: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

9.plot: LA Music Blogger Marcus Slater returns once again to The Autry at Griffith Park for some perfect summer weather to go along with his food truck food and a screening of Coming to America, appropriate for the July 4th weekend at Eat/See/Hear. Marcus interviews the Brooklyn electronic pop duo Cafuné, whose music is right up Marcus's alley, and LA Music Blog presents the band as they perform tracks from their latest EP.

10.title: Hawai

episode of.title: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

10.plot: Marcus Slater from LA Music Blog heads West toward the sea breeze found at Santa Monica High School for a round of food, fun, and music at Eat/See/Hear! Ahead of the outdoor screening of John Waters' cult 80's classic Hairspray, Marcus interviews and catches a performance of Hawai (pronounced huh-why), an Orange County alternative group that details their latest EP and how the OC influences their sound!

11.title: Paper Pilots

episode of.title: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

11.plot: LA Music Blogger Marcus Slater is back at The Autry Museum in Griffith Park for some fun and a touch of class at Eat/See/Hear as he chomps down on some great local food truck food and views the wonderful Alfred Hitchcock classic, North By Northwest. Before the film's screening, Marcus interviews the Brit-pop inspired Paper Pilots, who discuss their rise on the radio, their latest single "The Weather," and more.

12.title: Naomi

episode of.title: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

12.plot: Host and producer David Fisch speaks on behalf of LA Music Blog to chat with the lovely and grungy folk solo artist Naomi before a screening of the cult classic 90's film Trainspotting at The Autry in Griffith Park for Eat/See/Hear. She explains why her name is inside brackets, what about LA she brings to her mix of Middle Eastern indie folk, and she also provides a fun performance!

13.title: State to State

episode of.title: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

13.plot: LA Music Blog proudly presents the LA-based-but-from-everywhere alt/post rock band State To State, and producer/host David Fisch was on-site in front of Pasadena City Hall to chat with the quartet about their sound and more, plus he witnesses the band perform tracks off of their latest Motives EP before an outdoor screening of (500) Days of Summer as part of Eat/See/Hear.

14.title: King Washington

episode of.title: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

14.plot: Music blogger and reporter David Fisch is on the scene at The Autry at Griffith Park for another round of Eat/See/Hear, this time interviewing the LA roots rock band King Washington. He tries to unlock what makes them one of LA's best bands on the rise before catching a performance from them ahead of an outdoor screen presentation of the movie that literally made Tom Hanks, Big!

15.title: Luca

episode of.title: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

15.plot: With the many rock-oriented acts that have taken over most of the "Hear" in Eat/See/Hear, it was due time for a little bit of soul to enter the summer event series with Ojai-based artist LUCA, who discusses his interests and yerba mate with music blogger David Fisch and performed before a screening of the 80's adventure classic, "The Goonies", at La Cienega Park in Beverly Hills.

16.title: Magic Bronson

episode of.title: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

16.plot: Ahead of an outdoor movie screening of the hilarious Mel Brook spoof about a familiar space opera, "Spaceballs," LA Music Blogger and reporter David Fisch interviews and catches a performance from a group that defies genre labels, Magic Bronson. They discuss their approach, what they've got in store, and which beloved "Spaceballs" characters they think are their favorite.

17.title: KONG.

episode of.title: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

17.plot: LA Music Blogger David Fisch returns to The Autry Museum in Griffith Park for Eat/See/Hear to help present the "jungle rock" stylings of and interview KONG. - ahead of an outdoor screening of the latest epic from Quentin Tarantino, a Western called "The Hateful Eight."

18.title: Isla June

episode of.title: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

18.plot: The up-and-coming local band Isla June brings a little bit of Southern and Motown soul to the cool breeze of Santa Monica High School before a screening of one of the "brat pack" films from the 80's, "Pretty In Pink." They perform and interview with LA Music Blogger David Fisch where they discuss how they met, who influences them, and more.

19.title: VOKES

episode of.title: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

19.plot: For the very last event of the Eat/See/Hear summer outdoor movie series at Santa Monica High School, alt-soul multi-instrumentalist VOKES stopped by to interview with David Fisch and perform tracks off of his first EP, Fractalism, ahead of a screening of "Purple Rain," honoring the now-late Prince, who passed away earlier this year.

imdb.title: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear
akas: LA Music Blog Presents Live Music at Eat/See/Hear (United States)
plot: Hosts from the LA Music Blog interview and introduce all of the brightest, up-and-coming LA-based bands performing at 2016's outdoor movie, food truck and live music event series Eat/See/Hear, sponsored by Showtime.::David Fisch
